goals.question: What is the trend of electricity consumption in Iowa over the years?
goals.visualization: Line chart of electricity consumption over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if the electricity consumption in Iowa is increasing, decreasing or remaining constant over the years.

goals.question: What is the distribution of residential electricity consumption in Iowa?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of residential electricity consumption in Iowa and if there are any outliers.

goals.question: What is the correlation between commercial and industrial electricity consumption in Iowa?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of commercial and industrial electricity consumption
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a positive or negative correlation between commercial and industrial electricity consumption in Iowa.

goals.question: What is the average electricity consumption per capita in Iowa?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of electricity consumption per capita
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the average electricity consumption per person in Iowa and how it compares to other states.

goals.question: What is the seasonal pattern of electricity consumption in Iowa?
goals.visualization: Line chart of electricity consumption by month
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a seasonal pattern to electricity consumption in Iowa and if so, what months have the highest and lowest consumption.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Year'], format='%Y', errors='coerce')
    sns.lineplot(x='Year', y='Consumption', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the trend of electricity consumption in Iowa over the years?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Residential'] = pd.to_numeric(data['Residential'], errors='coerce')
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='Residential', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['Residential'].mean(), color='red', label='Mean: {:.2f}'.format(data['Residential'].mean()))
    plt.axvline(data['Residential'].median(), color='green', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['Residential'].median()))
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of residential electricity consumption in Iowa?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Year'], format='%Y', errors='coerce')
    chart = sns.scatterplot(x='Commercial', y='Industrial', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the correlation between commercial and industrial electricity consumption in Iowa?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Consumption per capita'] = data['Retail sales of electricity to ultimate customers (million kWh)']/data['Population']
    iowa_data = data[data['State'] == 'Iowa']
    iowa_consumption = iowa_data['Consumption per capita'].values[0]
    sns.barplot(x='State', y='Consumption per capita', data=data)
    plt.axhline(y=iowa_consumption, color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Iowa consumption: {iowa_consumption:.2f}')
    plt.legend()
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data['Month'] = data['Date'].dt.month
    data = data.groupby('Month').sum().reset_index()
    chart = sns.lineplot(x='Month', y='Consumption', data=data)
    chart.set(xlabel='Month', ylabel='Electricity Consumption')
    plt.title('What is the seasonal pattern of electricity consumption in Iowa?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Consumption per capita'] = data['Retail sales of electricity to ultimate customers (million kWh)']/data['Population']
    iowa_data = data[data['State'] == 'Iowa']
    iowa_consumption = iowa_data['Consumption per capita'].values[0]

    plt.axhline(y=iowa_consumption, color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Iowa consumption: {iowa_consumption:.2f}')
    plt.legend()
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
